results.question: i am a student can i get UK visa?
results.response:
COUNTRY: UK

VISA TYPE:
Student visa (for courses longer than 6 months)

ELIGIBILITY:
- Can support yourself financially and pay tuition fees.
- Meet health and character requirements.
- Have provided all mandatory supporting documents.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:
- Current passport or travel document.
- Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS) issued by a licensed Student sponsor.
- Financial evidence (if required).
- If previously fully sponsored, a consent letter from the sponsor.

NOTES:
- If any required evidence is missing or doesn't meet format rules, the application can be refused.
- The CAS must be for the course you intend to study and must not have been used in a previous application.
- The consent letter from the previous sponsor must be on official letterhead, include specific details, and confirm support for the new course.

FINAL SUMMARY:
Eligibility for a UK student visa depends on meeting financial, health, and character requirements, and providing all necessary documents, including a valid passport and CAS. If you were previously fully sponsored, you will need a consent letter from the sponsor.

results.question: eligibility creiteria for india visa
results.response:
COUNTRY: India

VISA TYPE: Intern Visa ['I']

ELIGIBILITY:
- Foreigner intending to pursue internship in Indian companies, Educational Institutions and NGOs.
- Restricted to the duration of the internship programme or one year, whichever is less.
- Maximum of 50 interns per year for each Indian Mission/ Post (100 for countries with PIO population > 1 million).
- Granted immediately after completion of graduation/ post graduation.
- Gap between completion of graduation/ post graduation and commencement of internship should not be more than two years.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:
- Letter from the Indian company/ educational institution/ NGO.

NOTES:
- Data not present.

FINAL SUMMARY:
The Intern Visa is for foreigners pursuing internships in India, with specific limitations on duration, number of interns, and timing relative to graduation. A letter from the host organization is required.

results.question: i am 30 years can i get an UK visa
results.response:
COUNTRY: UK

VISA TYPE:
Student visa (for courses longer than 6 months)

ELIGIBILITY:
- Can support yourself financially and pay tuition fees.
- Meet health and character requirements.
- Provide all mandatory supporting documents.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:
- Current passport or travel document.
- If from a TB-listed country, a TB certificate.
- Financial evidence (if required).
- English evidence (if required).
- ATAS certificate (if required).

NOTES:
- Applicants extending their visa from inside the UK after 12 continuous months of lawful residence may not need to show funds.

FINAL SUMMARY:
The documents detail requirements for a UK Student visa, including financial and academic qualifications, and passport. Since you are 30, parental consent documents are not required.

results.question: i own a company can i have india visa?
results.response:
COUNTRY: India

VISA TYPE: Business Visa

ELIGIBILITY:
- To establish an industrial/business venture, other than Proprietorship Firms and Partnership Firms, in India.
- To purchase/sell industrial products or commercial products or consumer durables.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:
- Information not present in provided documents.

NOTES:
- Business Visa can be extended up to a maximum period of five years subject to the gross sales/turnover from the business activities is not less than Rs.1 crore per annum.
- India Business Card will be issued to businessmen from SAARC countries who are eligible for a multiple entry Business Visa for a period of three years or more.

FINAL SUMMARY:
You may be eligible for a Business Visa if you meet the criteria for establishing or exploring business ventures (excluding Proprietorship/Partnership Firms) or for buying/selling industrial or commercial products. Businessmen from SAARC countries may be eligible for an India Business Card.

results.question: i own a house in inida can i have a Schengen visa?
results.response:
COUNTRY: SCHENGEN AREA

VISA TYPE:
SHORT STAY VISAS: UNIFORM VISA or VISA WITH LIMITED TERRITORIAL VALIDITY; AIRPORT TRANSIT VISA

ELIGIBILITY:
- Not specified if owning a house in India makes you eligible for a Schengen visa. General requirements include justifying the purpose and conditions of your stay and having sufficient means of subsistence.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:
- Documents justifying the purpose and conditions of the intended stay.
- Proof of sufficient means of subsistence.

NOTES:
- Mere possession of a Schengen visa does not guarantee entry.
- Visa holders may be asked to produce documents at the border.
- Applications can be submitted to an external service provider.

FINAL SUMMARY:
The document does not specify whether owning a house in India affects Schengen visa eligibility. Owning property is not mentioned as either a requirement or a disqualification.

results.question: What are eligibility criteria for Ireland visa
results.response:
COUNTRY: Ireland

VISA TYPE:
Employment (based on Employment Permit), Intra-Company Transfer

ELIGIBILITY:
- Holding a valid employment permit (Critical Skills, General, Intra-Company Transfer, Contract for Services, Exchange Agreement, Internship, Sports & Cultural).
- For Intra-Company Transfer, the applicant must be legally resident and employed in another EU Member State.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:
- Full colour copy of residence permission (front and back if residence card)
- Documentation on Previous Visa Refusals, Other immigration Issues and Criminal Convictions
- Signed application letter (full contact details, reason for visit, family in Ireland/EU, length of stay, place of stay, undertaking to observe visa conditions, not become a burden, and leave on expiry)
- Marriage/birth certificates
- Explanation for missing documents
- Employment permit copy
- Employment contract copy
- Letter from Irish employer (job details, salary, accommodation details if provided)
- Evidence of qualifications and experience (payslips, salary payments, employment letter, tax statements, certificates)
- Evidence of finances
- For Intra-Company Transfer: Letter from EU employer (residency and employment confirmation, service details, return confirmation, contract details, Irish company contact)
- For Intra-Company Transfer: Letter from Irish company (contract details, reason for employee)
- For Intra-Company Transfer: Evidence of right to reside and work in the sending EU member state and of permission to return there.

NOTES:
- Must explain inability to provide required documents.

FINAL SUMMARY:
The visa eligibility for Ireland depends on the type of employment and requires specific documents related to the employment and personal circumstances. For intra-company transfers, additional documentation is required from both the sending and host companies.

results.question: What are eligibility criteria for Student India visa
results.response:
COUNTRY: India

VISA TYPE: Student Visa

ELIGIBILITY:
- Foreigner whose sole objective is to pursue on-campus, full time courses at educational institutions recognized by a statutory regulatory body.
- Must produce proof of admission to a full time course.
- Institutions must comply with GST regulations.
- For private institutions NIIT, APTECH, Tata Infotech, Software Technology Group, and DSK Global Education & Research Limited, Pune; must be conducting courses at their own premises, not franchise or off-campus.
- Must open NRO account (Non Resident Ordinary) in India.
- In case of extension, sponsorship by the Institution is required.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:
- Proof of admission to a full time course.
- Details of NRO account.
- Provisional admission certificate / letter of offer or advertisement for admission (for Provisional Student Visa)
- Application for admission and letter from the educational institution confirming receipt of application (for extension of Provisional Student Visa).

NOTES:
- Student Visa will not be issued to foreign nationals sponsored by franchise Educational Institutes running off -campus centres, Study Centres of Open Universities offering distance learn ing programmes, Educational Institutes running “outreach” programmes and offering courses without any statutory sanction from regulatory authorities.
- Student Visa will not be issued for pursuing ‘Short Term Courses’ in India which are not recognized.
- Visa validity shall not exceed 5 years.
- A maximum of four entries per academic year may be allowed to foreign students.
- Prior clearance of the Ministry of Home Affairs may be required.
- Dependents do not get a dependent visa.
- Change of institution shall be allowed if student has reasonable ground of insufficient infrastructure, paucity of facility, unavailability of the course of their choice or either of them.
- No special permission is required for completion of such industrial training / internship etc .

FINAL SUMMARY:
The Student Visa is for individuals pursuing full-time education at recognized Indian institutions. Several eligibility criteria and conditions apply to the type of institution, course, and financial sustenance.
